key_points: Republican Representative Michael Guest discussed his views on recent events including the election, Capitol insurrection, and impeachment.
Guest mentioned that the past three months have been unprecedented in modern U.S. history.
He acknowledged voter irregularities but did not believe they were significant enough to overturn election results.
Guest challenged the certification of election results in two states, citing violations of legislative will, not widespread fraud.
He described meeting Trump supporters in D.C. and educating them about the electoral process.
Guest was present at the Capitol during the insurrection and detailed the experience of being locked in the House chamber.
He believes there is shared blame for the Capitol insurrection, not solely resting on Trump.
Guest disagrees with many statements made by Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene but opposes using those to remove her from committees.
He supports a proposal to remove Greene from the Education and Labor Committee but allow her to remain on the Budget Committee.
The conversation reflects on the challenges and controversies facing Congress in light of recent political events.
